head.supplied: Melbourne botanical and Zoological Gardens, ¶ 29 Sept. 1858. ¶ Sir ¶ ¶ I have the honor to acknowledge the receipt of your communication, dated Sept. 25th, ¶ and beg to thank the City Council for ad...

div.p: Unit 10, VPRS 3621 inward correspondence from Government, VA 511 Melbourne, Public Record Office, Victoria.

I have the honor to acknowledge the receipt of your communication, dated Sept. 25th,
E. FitzGibbon to M, 25 September 1858. and beg to thank the City Council for adopting the measure, that bathing should not be tolerated in the Yarra Yarra, except on secluded spots and before the hours of 6 a.m. in summer and 7 a.m. in Winter.

But since neither the locality, frequented by the bathers, is secluded, nor by them properly adhered to the hours fixed by the Municipality, I beg to solicit, that a caution board may be erected on the banks of the Yarra, close to the new footbridge, to give the resolution of the council local publicity and practical effect.

p.style: font-family: Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 1.75in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: 0in;

div.p: I have the honor to be

div.p: your most obedient and humble servant

div.p: Director of the zool. & botan. Garden.

Town Clerk &c&c&c.
See also M to E. FitzGibbon, 1 December 1858.
